creditline: Gift of Charles and Robyn Citrin
markings: BL, below image, graphite: TR; graphite dot in BLC; BRC, graphite: 8/2-1; verso BLC, graphite: Ham 93.233; verso BRC, graphite: 151991-11 / 262-8-93
text: Three butterflies in various colors flutter through darkness. The background is sometimes lined, sometimes not; the butterflies are sometimes fuzzy, sometimes crisp. Through subtle changes in color, Hamaguchi experiments with the overall mood of the print. Even small-scale prints like these could take months to make, especially since he had to make a plate for each of the four colors: black, yellow, red, and blue.
title: Three Butterflies
